title: Beware, this WhatsApp link will instantly crash your Android phone
description: A new bugged WhatsApp link that's been spreading around will instantly crash your Android phone.

title: iPhone 15 screen sizes: What we’re expecting
description: Expect more of the same in terms of screen size for the iPhone 15, but the 2024 model could get bigger.

title: First-gen Chromecast owners will need to upgrade after Google terminates support
description: Google is pulling the plug for good on its original Chromecast after months of no support.

title: AMD may be embarrassing Nvidia in the mid-range GPU market
description: According to several reports from retailers, AMD’s RX 7600 may be outselling Nvidia’s RTX 4060 Ti in spades.

title: This video maker's new AI editing tool picks your best takes for you
description: Veed launches AI editing tool that cleans up hesitations, deviations, or repetitions in video maker app.

title: Motorola Razr 40 Ultra may miss out on this useful Galaxy Flip 4 feature
description: A Motorola Razr 40 Ultra specs leak suggests water resistance still might not be part of the equation.

title: A critical Barracuda security backdoor has been exploited for months, so patch now
description: Hackers have been exploiting a Barracuda zero-day since October 2022, allowing them to steal files, and more.

title: Stylish puzzler Escape Academy has new DLC on the horizon
description: Co-op puzzler Escape Academy is about to receive a brand new DLC package alongside details for an upcoming Switch release.

title: Microsoft says it's 'fixed' a dodgy Surface webcam bug, but I’ve got bigger concerns
description: Microsoft has issued a temporary fix for a bug that was disabling the webcam on some Surface models, but there's a bigger issue.

title: That ChatGPT Google ad may be hiding some nasty malware
description: A threat actor was spotted advertising fake software through Google Ads.

title: WordPress force installs update on 5 million sites following security worry
description: A super popular WordPress plugin had been carrying a major security flaw for several years.

title: Twitter moderation is about to get much worse - and its all Elon Musk's fault
description: Block Party, a helpful anti-harassment tool, has left Twitter - and left users lost amid a rise in toxic content on the platform.

title: Google's Pixel Watch 2 could drop Samsung's processors for better battery life
description: Google’s Pixel Watch 2 is now expected to switch from Exynos to Qualcomm chips, to facilitate battery life improvements and more.

title: Web.com and GoDaddy join IONOS and Wix on the Generative AI integration movement
description: Web.com adds two new AI features, GoDaddy adds three, while IONOS integrates ChatGPT.

title: Definitely-not-political FPS Six Days in Fallujah is coming to Early Access soon
description: Controversial shooter Six Days in Fallujah gets an Early Access release date of June 22.

title: Multiple Macs tipped for WWDC 2023 unveiling, but what could they be?
description: Apple's WWDC 2023 is just around the corner and we've been told to expect "several" new Macs to be unveiled.

title: Slack facing widespread protests to introduce end-to-end encryption
description: Over 90 organizations are urging Slack to introduce end-to-end encryption and other privacy-focused tools.

title: Metal Gear Solid 3 remake looks like it will contain all the original voices and lines
description: The upcoming Metal Gear Solid 3 remake is likely using the same original voice cast and lines without changing much at all.

title: Microsoft Teams might have just given you a great excuse to miss calls for ever
description: Microsoft Teams now uses GPT AI to write meeting notes, in cased you missed it.

title: Arnie's FUBAR TV show is a big hit – here are 3 of his movies on Netflix to follow it up
description: Arnold Schwarzenegger is back – and the debut season of his action-packed Netflix show FUBAR looks like a huge hit.

title: Fraud of all kinds is only getting worse in the UK and EU
description: Research uncovers some worrying new trends in world of fraud, as new tech brings new opportunities.

title: The Apple VR headset display could be 50 times brighter than your Oculus Quest 2’s
description: Apple's VR headset display has been leaked; the micro OLED panel apparently offers 4K visuals and 5,000 nits of brightness.

title: Microsoft found a critical security bug in macOS that could have many users worried
description: Apple released a fix earlier this month, so make sure to apply it fast.

title: What not to share with ChatGPT
description: ChatGPT has sprung up everywhere, but be careful what you say to the bot, we don't know if it keeps secrets.

title: Devolver Digital announces June showcase with unsettling new mascot
description: Publishing powerhouse Devolver Digital has announced a fresh showcase for early June alongside a deeply weird trailer.

title: Audio-Technica’s famed Sound Burger decks finally hit shelves – and seemingly sell out
description: AT announced the re-release of its iconic compact vinyl player at CES 2023 in January and the decks finally went on sale today – then apparently sold out in white and black, although a yellow version will go on sale later this summer.

title: Microsoft’s appeal against UK government’s block on Activision Blizzard acquisition to begin in July
description: Microsoft has made good on its promise to appeal the UK government’s decision to block its acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

title: Microsoft is preparing to unleash Bing AI on Chrome and Firefox browsers
description: The Bing chatbot will soon get a big update, and it’ll likely bring the change many crave – the ability to avoid Edge.

title: Garmin Fenix 7 Pro and Epix Pro unveiled with new LED flashlights and features
description: We’re no longer in the dark! Garmin Fenix 7 Pro and Epix Pro have arrived, and they look great.

title: These spyware-riddled Android apps have been installed over 400 million times - here's how to stay safe
description: Over 100 Android apps found carrying a malicious SDK, but not all have been removed from the Play Store yet.

title: The iPhone 16 Pro will reportedly be taller and narrower than the iPhone 15 Pro
description: New rumors suggest the iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Ultra will have a different aspect ratio to their predecessors.

title: Oculus Quest 3 hands-on teases huge upgrades and one worrying downgrade
description: Meta’s Oculus Quest 3 might be better than both the Quest 2 and Quest Pro, but can it beat the Apple VR headset?

title: Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 certification suggests we’re on track for a July launch
description: The Samsung Galaxy Tab S9 Plus and Ultra have been certified, suggesting an imminent launch and 45W charging.

title: Apple Music Classical launches on Android before getting a real iPad or Mac version
description: The Apple Music Classical app has come to Android devices – before either iPad or MacBook devices get an official app.

title: SMBs are keen to boost IT investment, even as costs rise
description: European SMBs want to nail hybrid working tech and cybersecurity before they embark on cloud migration, report claims.

title: Windows 11 has a nifty new feature – but enabling it is a hassle
description: Windows 11 now has what might be its most useful widgets yet, but there’s a catch with getting them set up.

title: HP revenues plummet as printers, PC sales all fall
description: Consumers are spending less with HP, and commercial customers don’t look to have much deeper pockets either.

title: Mortal Kombat 1 to run online stress test before launch - and you can take part
description: Mortal Kombat 1 will be running an online stress test before launch, and you can participate by registering your interest.

title: 7 signs Cooler Master has gone bonkers at Computex 2023, and that’s a good thing
description: Cooler Master is living its best life at the moment, and I am here for it.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Wednesday, May 31 (game #492)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: Apple Music Classical plays a second chord – this time on Android
description: Still housing millions of tracks, the music streaming service on Android maintains the same high quality as heard on iOS.
